intro: Nordenstamia cajamarcensis, commonly known as the Andean orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of northern Peru. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant coloration. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic growth habit. Its flowers are small but intricately designed, often featuring a complex arrangement of petals and sepals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nordenstamia cajamarcensis is considered a conservation concern.
